title: Can anyone identify the South Shore Line font?
content:
Hello, I am quite new and know nothing about fonts—so I thought I could ask here and the question could be answered pretty quickly. I am looking for a font that closely resembles this—I know this is a hand drawn print, but is there something that resembles this in the font world:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20071103234427im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/autumn_4484.jpg)

 [‹ tarzana](http://web.archive.org/web/20071103234427/http:/www.typophile.com/node/38370 "Go to previous forum topic") [Splendid Grotesk ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071103234427/http:/www.typophile.com/node/38174 "Go to next forum topic")
author: juliet3353

comments.content: It’s lettered by hand, not with a font. You might like [Pueblo](http://web.archive.org/web/20071103234427/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/creative_alliance/pueblo/) or [Cooper](http://web.archive.org/web/20071103234427/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/paratype/cooper_ot/).
thanks! I thought they looked hand lettered, wasn’t sure...these fonts are great!
